name: BuildWheel
description: Creates wheels using all installed copies of Python.
helpMarkDown: The *Build Python wheels* task uses a `setup.py` file to compile wheels. It will ensure that `pip`, `wheel`, `setuptools` and `cython` are installed before running.
author: Steve Dower

inputs.name: outputdir
inputs.label: Output Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Folder where wheels will be written. By default, `$(Build.BinariesDirectory)\dist` is used. The `BuildWheel.dist` output variable is set to this folder.

inputs.name: universal
inputs.label: Create a Universal wheel
inputs.helpMarkDown: Marks the wheel as universal. Only the last found copy of Python will be used to build the wheel.

inputs.name: dependencies
inputs.label: Dependencies
inputs.helpMarkDown: Packages to install prior to building wheels. Prefix with `--upgrade` to ensure you have the latest version.

inputs.name: usemsbuild
inputs.label: Use MSBuild for building extensions
inputs.helpMarkDown: Adds the [`pyfindvs`](https://pypi.org/p/pyfindvs) package and uses it to locate and build with MSBuild instead of the built-in module. Recommended for Python 3.5 and later.

inputs.name: signcmd
inputs.label: Signing command
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional command to execute between `build` and `bdist_wheel`.

inputs.name: python
inputs.label: Python
inputs.helpMarkDown: Directory containing the `python.exe` to use. By default, all installs added by either the Install Python or Use Python task will be used.

inputs.name: builddir
inputs.label: Build Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Base directory for temporary build artifacts. By default, `$(Build.BinariesDirectory)` is used.

inputs.name: workingdir
inputs.label: Working Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Working directory for running the build. By default, the directory containing setup.py will be used.

outputVariables.name: dist
outputVariables.description: The directory distribution files were written to.
